sentence.Network_en: My gargantuan, pristine machine was good for writing papers and playing solitaire, and that was all.
sentence.Network_cn: 我那庞大的 、 早期的计算机只适合写文章和玩纸牌游戏, 就这些.

sentence.Network_en: I am divided from mankind, a solitaire, one banish'd from humane society.
sentence.Network_cn: 我与世隔绝,仿佛是一个隐士, 一个流放者.

sentence.Network_en: Computer solitaire , paper airplanes, last week's rubber - band war.
sentence.Network_cn: 电脑纸牌, 叠飞机, 上个星期还有皮筋大战.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: from French, from Latin solitarius (see solitary)

encyclopedia.content: 欧美流行歌曲 Solitaire原唱：Neil Sedaka，年份：在1972年作者：Neil Sedaka and Phil Cody 翻唱The Carpenters，Andy Williams , Jann Arden, Sheryl Crow, Clay Aiken, Sissel, and Elvis Presley,Westlife. westlife版英文歌词： There was a man A lonely man Who lost his love Through his indifference A heart that cared That went unshared Until it died Within his silence And solitaire's the only game in town A

entry.tran: 单人跳棋(独自一人玩的一种游戏，玩者移动盘上棋子的位置，直至最后剩下一枚棋子为止)
entry.def: Solitaire is a game for one person in which you move and remove objects on a board, with the aim of having one object left at the end of the game.
Solitaire is a card game for only one player.

entry.tran: (镶嵌于戒指或其他珠宝饰物上的)独粒钻石，独粒宝石
entry.def: A solitaire is a diamond or other jewel that is set on its own in a ring or other piece of jewellery.

means.word_mean: 1. a gem (usually a diamond) in a setting by itself
2. extinct flightless bird related to the dodo
3. dull gray North American thrushes noted for its beautiful song
4. a card game played by one person
